snippet: Even after a fall of as much as 25 percent in oil prices, several reports say it would take a drop of $10 to $20 more a barrel to slow production even modestly.
abstract: Oil experts say boom in American energy production shows no signs of slowing down, even as falling oil and gasoline prices have sent oil company stocks tumbling.
lead_paragraph: Even after a fall of as much as 25 percent in oil prices, several reports say it would take a drop of $10 to $20 more a barrel to slow production even modestly.

headline.main: Despite Slumping Prices, No End in Sight for U.S. Oil Production Boom
headline.print_headline: Despite Slumping Prices, No End in Sight for U.S. Oil Production Boom

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations
